sen.e: Descendants of Yoriari, a younger brother of Yoriyuki, successively filled the post of Izumi Shugo from the mid 14th century.

sen.j: 頼長のあと、持有、教春、常有（教春の弟）、元有（常有の孫）と守護職を世襲した。
sen.e: Mochiari, Noriharu, Tsuneari (a younger brother of Noriharu) and Motoari (a grand son of Tsuneari) filled posts of Shugo by heredity, after Yorinaga.
Mochiari, Noriharu, Tsuneari (a younger brother of Noriharu) and Motoari (a grand son of Tsuneari) served as Shugo by heredity, after Yorinaga.
sen.cmt: filled posts of→served as と修正しました。
sen.e: Mochiari, Noriharu, Tsuneari (a younger brother of Noriharu) and Motoari (a grand son of Tsuneari) served as Shugo by heredity, after Yorinaga.

sen.j: 細川元有は和泉下守護家とともに紀伊国守護畠山尚順と同盟を組み、管領細川政元と敵対していた。
sen.e: Motoari HOSOKAWA and Shugo family of lower Izumi Province formed an alliance with Shugo of Kii Province Hisanobu HATAKEYAMA, together they were contending against Kanrei, Masamoto HOSOKAWA.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処

sen.e: However, the family was a powerful retainer of the shogun, such as Nariuji performed a haircut at the kakan (put a crown on a young man's head on a genpuku ceremony) of the 3rd Shogun Yoshimitsu ASHIKAGA and Harutsune HOSOKAWA, a descendant of Nariuji, also performed a haircut at the kakan of the 13th Shogun Yoshiteru ASHIKAGA.

sen.j: 和泉上守護家の藤孝の子・忠興が戦国時代末期の当主細川輝経の養子となり奥州家を継承した。
sen.e: Tadaoki, a son of Fujitaka of Shugo family of upper Izumi Province, became an adopted child to Terutsune HOSOKAWA, the family head in the end of Sengoku period, and inherited Oshu family.

sen.e: Tadaoki, the son of Fujitaka of the Shugo family of upper Izumi Province, became an adopted child to Terutsune HOSOKAWA, the family head in the end of Sengoku Period, and inherited the Oshu family.

tit.e: Hosokawa clan and the modern times

tit.j: 肥後細川家（豊前小倉藩、肥後熊本藩主家）

sen.j: 和泉上守護家の出身の細川幽斎（幽斎）は、はじめ室町幕府15代将軍足利義昭を支えたが、のち織田信長に属して姓を長岡と改め、丹後国12万石を領した。
sen.e: Initially, Yusai HOSOKAWA (Yusai) from Shugo family of upper Izumi Province supported 15th Shogun of Muromachi bakufu, Yoshiaki ASHIKAGA but later he served Nobunaga ODA, changing surname to Nagaoka, and the family possessed 120,000 koku (33360 cubic meters).

Initially, Yusai HOSOKAWA (Yusai) from the Shugo family of upper Izumi Province supported the 15th shogun of the Muromachi bakufu, Yoshiaki ASHIKAGA, but later he served Nobunaga ODA, changing the surname to Nagaoka, and the family possessed 120,000 koku of Tango Province.
sen.cmt: the, カンマを補いました。Shogun→shogun と修正しました。カッコ部分を削除し、「丹後国」を補いました。
sen.e: Initially, Yusai HOSOKAWA (Yusai) from the Shugo family of upper Izumi Province supported the 15th shogun of the Muromachi bakufu, Yoshiaki ASHIKAGA, but later he served Nobunaga ODA, changing the surname to Nagaoka, and the family possessed 120,000 koku of Tango Province.

sen.j: 長男の細川忠興（三斎）は、紀伊国雑賀攻めで初陣し、信長の部将として活躍。
sen.e: His eldest son, Tadaoki (Sansai) HOSOKAWA took uijin (first battle) in Saiga of Ki Province attack and did splendid service as busho (commanding officer) of Nobunaga.

sen.e: His first son, Tadaoki (Sansai) HOSOKAWA took uijin (first battle) in the attack of Saiga of Ki Province, and did splendid service as busho (commanding officer) of Nobunaga.

sen.j: 本能寺の変では、妻・細川ガラシャの父・明智光秀に与せず、豊臣秀吉に仕えた。
sen.e: Yusai did not follow Mitsuhide AKECHI who was father of his wife, Gracia HOSOKAWA and served Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI.
Yusai did not follow Mitsuhide AKECHI who was the father of his wife, Garasha HOSOKAWA, and served Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI.

sen.e: Yusai did not follow Mitsuhide AKECHI who was the father of his wife, Garasha HOSOKAWA, and served Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI.

sen.j: 幽斎は古今伝授の継承者、忠興は千利休の高弟として、文化面でも重きをなした。
sen.e: Yusai and Tadaoki were also influential in cultural field, as Yusai was a successor of Kokin denju (the secret transmissions of the "Kokinshu," Anthology of Old and New Japanese Poems) and Tadaoki was a high-caliber disciple of SEN no Rikyu.

Yusai and Tadaoki were also influential in the cultural field, as Yusai was a successor of Kokin denju (the secret transmissions of the "Kokinshu," Anthology of Old and New Japanese Poems) and Tadaoki was a high-caliber disciple of SEN no Rikyu.

Yusai and Tadaoki were also influential in the cultural field, as Yusai was a successor of Kokin denju (the secret transmissions of the "Kokinshu," Anthology of Old and New Japanese Poems) and Tadaoki was a high-caliber disciple of SEN no Rikyu.

sen.j: 秀吉の死後、徳川家康（東軍）と石田三成（西軍）らの争いが始まると、東軍につき、ガラシャは西軍の人質になることを拒んで自害、幽斎は田辺城_(丹後国)で2ヶ月に及ぶ籠城戦を戦い、忠興は関ヶ原の戦いで活躍した。
sen.e: When a battle between Ieyasu TOKUGAWA (the 'eastern' army) and Mitsunari ISHIDA (the 'western' army) started after the death of Hideyoshi, the family sided with the 'eastern' army, there, Gracia committed suicide refusing to be a hostage of the 'eastern' army, Yusai fought in a tact of holding the castle at Tanabe-jo Castle (Tango Province) for 2 month and Tadaoki did distinguished service in the Battle of Sekigahara.

When the battle between Ieyasu TOKUGAWA (the eastern army) and Mitsunari ISHIDA (the western army) started after the death of Hideyoshi, the family sided with the eastern army, there, Garasha committed suicide refusing to be a hostage of the eastern army, Yusai fought in a siege of Tanabe-jo Castle (Tango Province) for two month and Tadaoki did distinguished service in the Battle of Sekigahara.
sen.cmt: クォーツを削除しました。Gracia→Garasha,a→the,2→two と修正しました。「篭城戦を戦い」の部分を修正しました。
sen.e: When the battle between Ieyasu TOKUGAWA (the eastern army) and Mitsunari ISHIDA (the western army) started after the death of Hideyoshi, the family sided with the eastern army, there, Garasha committed suicide refusing to be a hostage of the eastern army, Yusai fought in a siege of Tanabe-jo Castle (Tango Province) for two month and Tadaoki did distinguished service in the Battle of Sekigahara.

sen.j: 戦後は細川姓に復した。
sen.e: After the battle, they changed surname back to Hosokawa.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: After the battle, they changed the surname back to Hosokawa.

sen.j: 功により豊前国小倉藩39万9千石を経て、忠興の子・3代細川忠利の時代に肥後国熊本藩54万石を領し、幕末まで237年統治。
sen.e: As a result of distinguished services, the family possessed 399,000 koku (71975.61 cubic meters) in the Kokura domain, Buzen Province and later at generation of Tadatoshi HOSOKAWA, the third and son of Tadaoki, they possessed 540,000 koku (97410.6 cubic meters) in Kumamoto Domain, Higo Province and ruled for 237 years, until the end of Edo Period.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: As a result of the distinguished services, the family possessed 399,000 koku in the Kokura Domain, Buzen Province, and later at the generation of Tadatoshi HOSOKAWA, the third and son of Tadaoki, they possessed 540,000 koku in Kumamoto Domain, Higo Province and ruled for 237 years, until the end of Edo period.
sen.cmt: the, カンマを補いました。カッコ部分を削除しました。domain→Domain,Period→period と修正しました。
sen.e: As a result of the distinguished services, the family possessed 399,000 koku in the Kokura Domain, Buzen Province, and later at the generation of Tadatoshi HOSOKAWA, the third and son of Tadaoki, they possessed 540,000 koku in Kumamoto Domain, Higo Province and ruled for 237 years, until the end of Edo period.

sen.j: 明治に至り侯爵となる。
sen.e: The family became a marquis in Meiji period.
The family became a marquis in the Meiji period.
The family became a marquis in the Meiji period.

sen.j: 肥後細川家には藩主一門重臣として長岡内膳家と長岡刑部家があり、支藩としては新田（高瀬）支藩と宇土支藩があった。
sen.e: In Higo Hosokawa family, there were Nagaoka-naizen family and Nagaoka-Gyobu family as senior vassal of the lord family, and branch clan of Shinden (Takase) and branch clan of Uto as branch domain.

In the Higo Hosokawa family, there were the Nagaoka-naizen family and the Nagaoka-Gyobu family as senior vassals of the lord family, and the branch clan of Shinden (Takase) and the branch clan of Uto as branch domains.

sen.e: In the Higo Hosokawa family, there were the Nagaoka-naizen family and the Nagaoka-Gyobu family as senior vassals of the lord family, and the branch clan of Shinden (Takase) and the branch clan of Uto as branch domains.

sen.j: また、上卿三家といわれる世襲家老、松井氏（長岡佐渡、代々八代城3万石の城代）・米田氏（長岡監物）・有吉氏の三家があり、いずれも藤孝時代からの重臣である。
sen.e: Also there were three hereditary karo (the house elder) called the three families of shokei (the top court officials), the Matsui clan (Jodai (the keeper of castle) of Yatsushiro-jo Castle 30,000 koku (5411.7 cubic meters) in Nagaoka, Sado, for generations), the Komeda clan (Nagaoka Kambutsu duty) and the Ariyoshi clan, and all were senior vassals since the time of Fujitaka.

Also there were three hereditary karo (chief retainer) called the three families of shokei (the top court officials), the Matsui clan (Jodai [the keeper of castle] of Yatsushiro-jo Castle 30,000 koku in Nagaoka, Sado, for generations), the Komeda clan (Nagaoka Kambutsu duty) and the Ariyoshi clan, and all were senior vassals from the time of Fujitaka.

sen.j: なお、常陸谷田部藩は支藩ではなく、独立の藩である。
sen.e: Hitachi Yatabe clan was not a branch clan, but an independent clan.

sen.j: 8代細川重賢は、藩校時習館の創設や殖産興業など宝暦の改革と呼ばれる藩政改革を行い「肥後の鳳凰」と称された。
sen.e: The 8th family head, Shigekata HOSOKAWA carried out reformation of domain duties called Horeki Reform, which included the foundation of han school Jishukan and encouragement of new industries, and he was called 'a phoenix of Higo'.

sen.j: 出羽国米沢藩の上杉鷹山や紀伊国紀州藩の徳川治貞（紀州の麒麟）とともに江戸時代中期の三名君とされる。
sen.e: He is counted as three wise rulers in the middle of the Edo period along with Yozan UESUGI of Yonezawa Domain, Dewa Province and Harusada TOKUGAWA (Kirin (a mythical Chinese animal) of Kii) in the Kishu Domain, Kii Province.

sen.j: 熊本藩では江戸時代を通じて百姓一揆等が殆ど見られず農民は豊かであったとされる。
sen.e: It is believed that peasants were wealthy in Kumamoto domain and peasant's revolt did not happen throughout the Edo period.

sen.j: しかし、藩財政は厳しく、江戸・大坂の大商人からの借金に対しては何度も踏み倒して貧乏細川と嫌われている。
sen.e: However finance of the clan was a hard one and they were disliked and called 'indigent Hosokawa', as they repeatedly failed to pay debts to Great Merchants in Edo and Osaka.

sen.j: 国宝保存会会長を務めた16代細川護立は「美術の殿様」といわれた。
sen.e: The 16th family head, Moritatsu HOSOKAWA became the chair person of National Treasure Reserve Committee and he was called 'a lord of art'.

sen.j: 細川家伝来の多数の美術品や自らの収集品などを収蔵した財団法人永青文庫を開設している。
sen.e: He established Eisei Bunko Foundation that stored many art works passed down in Hosokawa family and his own collections.

sen.j: 近衛文麿の首相秘書官であった17代細川護貞は戦時中政治的活動も行い『細川日記』を残している。
sen.e: The 17th family head, Morisada HOSOKAWA took a post of secretary of the prime minister, Fumimaro KONOE, he also worked in political action during wartime and left "Hosokawa diary".

sen.j: 護貞は美術、華道、茶道の愛好家としても知られる。

sen.j: 1993年（平成5年）に内閣総理大臣となり非自民党連立政権を成立させた。
sen.e: He became prime minister in 1993 and formed non-LDP coalition administration.

sen.j: その弟で近衛家を相続した近衛忠てるは日本赤十字社社長。
sen.e: His younger brother, Tadateru KONOE who inherited Konoe Family was a President of Japanese Red Cross Society.

sen.j: 関ヶ原の戦いの後、忠興は徳川家との関係を重視し、警戒を解くために嫡男・細川忠隆とその妻・千世（前田利家の娘）の離縁を命じた。
sen.e: After the battle of Sekigahara, Tadaoki attached a great deal of importance to relationship with Tokugawa family, therefore he ordered a divorce of his legitimate son Tadataka HOSOKAWA and Tadataka's wife Chiyo (a daughter of Toshiie MAEDA) to end Tokugawa family's vigilance.

sen.cmt: the を補いました。attached a great deal of→considered,to→of と修正しました。

sen.j: これに反発した忠隆を廃嫡・勘当、家康に人質として差し出していた三男・内記（忠利）を跡継ぎとし、徳川家への臣従の意思を表した。
sen.e: Tadaoki showed a will of vassalage to Tokugawa family by disinherit Tadataka who opposed to the order, and made his third son Naiki (Tadatoshi), who had been presented at Ieyasu as a hostage, a successor.

sen.j: 廃嫡された忠隆は、京都で謹慎蟄居して長岡休無と号して祖父・細川幽斎の許に身を寄せた。
sen.e: Disinherited Tadataka stayed at his grand father Yusai HOSOKAWA and was at Kinshin Chikkyo (being placed in confinement at home) in Kyoto, naming himself Kyumu NAGAOKA.

sen.j: 幽斎死去後には細川家から扶持米3千石が給されることになった。
sen.e: After the death of Yusai, 3000 koku (541.17 cubic meters) of Fuchimai (salary rice) was supplied from Hosokawa family.

sen.j: 公家社会と細川家を結ぶ能や茶の湯の数寄者として、京都で余生を過ごした。
sen.e: He spent the rest of his life in Kyoto as a Sukisha (zen philosopher) in Chanoyu (the tea ceremony) and Noh that connected court noble society and Hosokawa family.

sen.j: 後妻・喜久との間に生まれた長岡忠恒・長岡忠春は、休無の死後に細川光尚から肥後熊本に招かれて熊本藩の一門家臣長岡内膳家となった。
sen.e: Tadatsune NAGAOKA and Tadaharu NAGAOKA, who were born between Kyumu and his second wife Kiku, were invited to Kumamoto, Higo by Mitsunao HOSOKAWA after the death of Kyumu and became Nagaoka-naizen family, a vassal of Kumamoto clan.

Tadatsune NAGAOKA and Tadaharu NAGAOKA, who were born between Kyumu and his second wife Kiku, were invited to Kumamoto, Higo by Mitsunao HOSOKAWA after the death of Kyumu and became the Nagaoka-naizen family, a vassal of the Kumamoto clan.

Tadatsune NAGAOKA and Tadaharu NAGAOKA, who were born between Kyumu and his second wife Kiku, were invited to Kumamoto, Higo by Mitsunao HOSOKAWA after the death of Kyumu and became the Nagaoka-naizen family, a vassal of the Kumamoto clan.

sen.j: 細川綱利時代に忠春の子・忠重（忠季）が計6千石を継ぎ、子孫は代々一門首座に列した。
sen.e: In the time of Tsunatoshi HOSOKAWA, Tadashige (Tadasue), a son of Tadaharu, took over total of 6000 koku (1082.34 cubic meters) and his descendant successively ranked as head of families.
In the time of Tsunatoshi HOSOKAWA, Tadashige (Tadasue), the son of Tadaharu, succeeded the total of 6000 koku, and his descendant successively ranked as the head of the family.

sen.e: In the time of Tsunatoshi HOSOKAWA, Tadashige (Tadasue), the son of Tadaharu, succeeded the total of 6000 koku, and his descendant successively ranked as the head of the family.

sen.j: 家紋は五七桐および細川九曜紋のほかに、ガラシャ出自を偲び明智氏の土岐桔梗紋を裏紋とした。
sen.e: The family crest was Goshichi no kiri and nine-planet crest of the Hosokawa family, and Toki's family crest of a stylized Chinese bellflower of Akechi clan was used for the Ura-mon to remember Gracia, the family background.

sen.j: 明治時代に細川姓へ復し、男爵を授爵した。

sen.j: 江戸時代の藩主の御茶屋で、明治時代に細川内膳家が住んだ熊本郊外の砂取邸跡は水前寺江津湖公園の一部（熊本県立図書館庭園）として整備されている。
sen.e: Sunatori-tei site, which was originally a ochaya (rest house) of the lord in Edo period and where Hosokawa-naizen family lived in Meiji period, in the suburbs of Kumamoto is maintained as a part of Suizenji-Ezuko Park (Kumamoto prefectural library garden).

sen.e: Ryugen HOSOKAWA, a political critic, and his nephew Ryuichiro HOSOKAWA were from a branch family of Makizaki of Naizen family.

sen.j: 刑部家が熊本郊外の子飼に設けた下屋敷（旧細川刑部邸）は県の重要文化財に指定され、現在は熊本城三の丸に移築・公開されている。
sen.e: Gyobu family's suburban residence built in Kokai, the suburb of Kumamoto, was designated as the prefectural important cultural property, and presently it has been reconstruct and open to the public at Sannomaru (outer part of the castle) of Kumamoto-jo Castle.

sen.j: 肥後熊本藩の支藩・熊本藩肥後新田藩、のち高瀬藩3万5千石の藩主。
sen.e: The family was the lord of Kumamoto domain Higo Shinden domain, a branch domain of Higo Kumamoto domain, and later became the lord of Takase domain with 35,000 koku (6313.65 cubic meters).
sen.cmt: 「熊本藩肥後新田藩」の訳については推察です。
sen.e: The family was the lord of the Higo Shinden Domain of the Kumamoto Domain, a branch domain of the Higo Kumamoto Domain, and later became the lord of the Takase Domain with 35,000 koku.
sen.cmt: スペースを修正しました。the を補いました。domain→Domain と修正しました。カッコ部分を削除しました。なお、「熊本藩肥後新田藩」の定訳は不明です。
sen.e: The family ruled a branch domain of the Higo Kumamoto Domain known as the Higo Shinden Domain (an area of land that had been newly made into a rice field with a yield of more than 10,000 koku) of the Kumamoto Domain, and later ruled the Takase Domain, which yielded 35,000 koku.
sen.cmt: 原文に合わせて修正しました。

sen.j: 細川光尚の子・細川利重から10代。
sen.e: The family continued for 10 generations since Toshishige HOSOKAWA, a child of Mitsunao HOSOKAWA.

sen.j: 江戸鉄砲洲に住み、幕末に肥後高瀬（熊本県玉名市）に移ったため高瀬藩とも言う。
sen.e: The family lived in Cannon Sandbar in Edo and moved to Higo, Takase (Tamana City, Kumamoto Prefecture) therefore they are also called as Takase clan.

sen.j: 5代細川興文は本藩の細川重賢と協力して藩校温知館の創設や水道による農地灌漑・殖産興業に努めるなど藩政改革を行った。
sen.e: The 5th family head, Okinori HOSOKAWA cooperated with Shigekata HOSOKAWA of Honpan (the original domain) for reformation of domain duties such as the foundation of han school Onchikan, and the farmland Irrigation and encouragement of new industries through a channel.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処

sen.j: 外様支藩主ながら幕府老中任用も議せられた。
